questions.question: What was Washington's main advice to America?

choices.answer: Make alliances with all countries.
Stay out of foreign wars and alliances.
Join wars to defend our friends.
Vote for his political party.

questions.question: What is a "precedent"?

choices.answer: The leader of the USA
The future.
An example for the future.
Good advice.

questions.question: Which law was an immigration restriction from John Adams?

choices.answer: Alien Act
Sedition Act
Chinese Exclusion Act
Immigration Quota Act

questions.question: What was illegal according to the Sedition Act?

choices.answer: Not paying a stamp tax.
Subscribing to questionable newspapers.
Insulting foreign allied countries
Writing negative articles about the president.

questions.question: Why did Jefferson make the Louisiana Purchase?

choices.answer: He had dreams of an agrarian republic.
Protesters hated the Proclamation of 1763
He wanted a more powerful central government
He wanted war with the Natives

questions.question: What happened directly because of the Louisiana Purchase?

choices.answer: Tecumseh led a Native rebellion
Extremists like Aaron Burr said the president can't buy land
13 new states joined the union
The US government went into debt forever

questions.question: What did Chief Tecumseh have to do with England?

choices.answer: He declared war against England.
He issued a trade embargo against England.
He got his guns from England.
He made an alliance with the French.

questions.question: How did the English instigate the War of 1812?

choices.answer: Impressing American sailors into their navy.
Blockading France and stopping American trade
Selling guns to Native Americans
Burning down the White House

questions.question: What invention led to an increase in slavery?

choices.answer: interchangeable parts
cotton gin
steam engine
railroad

questions.question: Which is an example of the Era of "Bad" Feelings?

choices.answer: All time economic highs
No major foreign wars
One political party
Wage workers and slavery

questions.question: What agreement divided the country between North and South?

choices.answer: Monroe Doctrine
Compromise of 1850
3/5ths Compromise
Missouri Compromise

questions.question: Why did the Cherokee tribe sue Jackson's government?

choices.answer: They were being wiped out in a war.
They had a treaty allowing them to stay in Georgia.
They didn't like the land in Oklahoma.
They disagreed with Jackson's tariff policy.

questions.question: What was the result of the Cherokee lawsuit?

choices.answer: They won but were forced to leave anyway.
They won and got to stay.
They lost and left on their own.
They lost and were forced to leave.

questions.question: How did Jackson overstep his power during Indian Removal?

choices.answer: The president can't use the military against foreign groups.
The president can't suggest laws to Congress.
The president can't make boastful public statements.
The president can't disregard a Supreme Court decision.

questions.question: Why was South Carolina angry at Andrew Jackson?

choices.answer: He expanded suffrage.
He gave his friends jobs.
He raised tariffs and taxes.
He vetoed the Bank.

questions.question: What is "nullification"?

choices.answer: A tax on an imported good.
Leaving the union and making your own country.
A state ignoring a federal law.
The federal government ignoring a state law.

questions.question: What does it mean to "secede"?

choices.answer: A tax on an imported good.
Leaving the union and making your own country.
A state ignoring a federal law.
The federal government ignoring a state law.

questions.question: What was South Carolina's view of government power during the Nullification Crisis?

choices.answer: States should have equal power with the Federal Government.
States should be more powerful than the federal government.
The federal govt should have complete power over the states.
The states should merge into one nation.

questions.question: What did Jackson believe about being president?

choices.answer: Presidents should strictly follow checks and balances.
Presidents should let states decide most issues.
Presidents should lay low and let Congress run things.
The prez should do whatever he needs to do to improve the US

questions.question: Who would call Jackson "King Andrew"?

choices.answer: Democratic supporters of Jackson
Whig opponents of Jackson
Opponents of nullification
Supporters of tariffs
